job_title: Registered Nurse in Port St Lucie, FL
pros: Enjoyed working for my immediate supervisor
cons: Heavy case load at times

pros: Great team environment and room for growth
cons: There are no downsides to working here

pros: It was something to do in the morning, and I got a paycheck.
cons: Management was not in touch with staff, top heavy.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Above average pay and used a tablet for notes
cons: Tablet was a little hard to learn, you're mostly on your own once you are placed.

job_title: CLM Manager in South Tampa, FL
pros: Not for profit, flexibility, pay
cons: The normal cons, administrative changes /policies etc

review_title: Pigs do fly, they are called Crows
pros: Supervisors were accessible M-F. Could complain to all my other miserable underpaid coworkers, who all leave!
cons:
Expect to work 55 hour weeks, and be paid for 40 , due to long visits, excessive driving and south Florida traffic. All which will drastically devalue your car, and give you heart disease. Their gas mileage rate is half of the standard rate, some weeks I drove over 500 miles! My heath insurance was $35 less than open marketplace..wow! Two years of tax returns I never made any overtime, outrageous. 

 They take every single case that comes to them, even though they do not have adequate staff, ever, and this will somehow become your problem !!! you will be bullied guilted and coerced into seeing your eighth or ninth patient a day, working your days off , working every holiday , and working most or (every) weekends. They refuse to hire a Baylor nurse. Patients are always calling you. You will spend most of your Evenings playing phone tag with patients and trying to plan your schedule for the next day, again all with no compensation. 

They are “non profit” so their tax filings are/were public at one point, USELESS administrators make millions, while nurses who are salaried are worked down to a rate into the teens many weeks. HHA paid $10.50, agency charges $25-60$ an hour for their services, the greed is unparalleled!

Not to mention the poor patients that aren’t seen if you won’t work on your day off, again I’ve never seen such greed.

pros: Flexible can take time off without pay
cons: Low pay. High insurance, low pto

pros: Not a good environment. Office staff gets fired frequently due to cut backs. Everyone is terrified of losing their jobs.
cons: Absolutely nothing good to say about this company.

job_title: RN Clinical Educator in Melbourne, FL
pros: Flexibility To be able to work from home
cons: Work home life balance is poor

review_title: Like all of the other agencies.
job_title: Home Health Aide in Port St Lucie, FL
pros:
There’s a lot work if you need. 
Flexibility if you want to work a lighter schedule.
cons: Pay is low. Sometimes they seem disorganized but could be trying to juggle many people.

pros: HR staff was friendly and knowledgeable. A job offer was extended and accepted. The position was to start in 2 weeks. All pre-employment testing ie drug and background were done and both were cleared and accepted by hiring staff.  A 25 page on board employee document package was signed and returned to hiring staff.
cons: The job offer was RESCINDED 48 HOURS BEFORE START DATE BY EMAIL!  The so-called explanation given was that due to budget restraints, the position was no longer needed and was not being filled. However, the position continued to be offered by the company and when called about it by an outside interest, the person was told by an HR staff member that the position was available and that they wanted to fill it ASAP.

review_title: The VNA is a GREAT Place to Work!
pros: I love working for the VNA. The main priority is patient care. There are high expectations from field staff to deliver exceptional care and supervisors to manage cases appropriately, but in order to achieve these things the VNA provides ongoing training for every discipline/department. Unfortunately, the staff that refuse to take the time to receive that training are the ones who consider the consequence harassment and unreasonable. However, we promise our patients and physicians our staff will deliver a higher level of care and that is what we do. This is why the VNA stands out above the rest.
cons: There are limited number of full-time positions. Most field staff positions are per visit.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Port Richey, FL
pros: I learned a lot from this company, in fact they built the foundation for my career in home health today!  I started out at the ground level and they always invested in me, promoted me and treated me well.  I progressed to a management level position and eventually left to take on a bigger challenge.  They are ethical, compliant, well organized and driven to take care of the patients and communities they serve.  There were a lot of changes throughout my many years here and for the most part they were positive changes.
cons: New staff tend to rule the roost for a while and it takes time to get things re-focused.

pros: 1 hour lunch not much else
cons: In my short time there it became clear the company is run by a bunch of nepotist . Do not expect the opportunity of advancement in the company. They try to keep a facade of being a "great place to work" it's such a lie. They fire people who chose to speak up and not tolerate being treated unfairly. They expect to pay the bare minimum and ask their employee's to do the job of 3 people without complaint. The workplace atmosphere in the stuart office is simply horrible and inefficient. The leadership team needs a complete overhaul. This was my worst job experience to date. I heard about their ways of practice before getting the job and should've listened!

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Spring Hill, FL
pros: Benefits paid for by company, FSA contributions. Most organized company I've ever worked for.  Good bonuses for working on call.
cons: Low paying for the area. Money hungry, corrupt bullies for nursing supervisors who were given "bonuses" based on their branches profit from Oasis visits.  Expected to go above and beyond job role too often (working after hours, working over productivity without being paid overtime).

review_title: Continues to keep missing on quality employees!
pros: CEO and Director of HR have been great to work with along with the HR team.
cons:
There are several executive managers that are dinosaurs and need to step away from their role.  They seem to be "entitled" and its hard to imagine why as they continue to make bad hiring decisions or running off the good employees.  

The company needs to take a hard look at their benefits package (holidays, PTO and bonuses) and wages across the entire company.

review_title: Presents itself as NOT  FOR PROFIT but really that is the employees  who can not make a decent salary.
job_title: Case Manager in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Flexibility is always important in nursing since they expect nurses to work 365 days a year with no monetary incentive.
cons: The turn over of staff is hard to deal with as it effects everyone. Constant new nurses, new schedulers etc.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse Field Nurse in Maitland, FL
pros: Ability to be out in the field, make up your own schedule, flexibilty, and working independently.
cons: Sometimes the driving for oneday could be over 100 miles a day, or the plan of care is notvery clear so the visit  is a total loss withoutthe proper documentation, amd god communication .

pros: Met some really awesome field staff
cons: No teamwork involved. Everyone for themselves. You had no support and could not trust in upper management to uphold policies and procedures to ALL staff, so some could do no wrong. DON very confrontational and nonprofessional. The staff is abused by upper management and schedulers. Miserable place to work

pros: they have recently improved benefits and rates to attract great nurses. The foundation is able to help people in the community when there are no other resources. They are not as money focused since they are not for profit.
cons: They do not have an office in the area I recently moved to.

pros: Nurses are amazing, field staff really excellent, managers busy, loyal and hardworking.  office staff are truly a team, caring and smart.  many staff here over 25 years, and new people have a career ladder.
cons: Not a place for non-hands on managers, everyone works hard

pros: Flexible work schedules as with any home health care agency.
cons: Disorganized company from the bottom up. Limited availability of supervisors to assist while you're in the field and usually do not have the answers when they are available.

pros: The Visiting Nurse Association of Florida is a wonderful company to work for. They are both invested in giving top care for their patients and working with their employees. They try to maintain a family like atmosphere.
cons: Communication between departments and branches could be improved. Compensation could be more competitive.

pros: Family oriented organization. Allows for advancement, educational opportunities and use of strong clinical skills. Management is approachable, and patient care is first. Allows flexibility of schedule and continuity of care. Excellent Interdisciplinary team work  and communication. Positive feedback from staff and management.
cons: As with any Home health organization, charting.

pros: They carry the good name of vna.
cons: They are very unorganized which makes it hard to tolerate as an employee and hard for the patients are being promised certain therapies at home but wont receive because they dont have the discipline (Speech, OT, or PT) available.

pros: This company knows how Home Health is supposed to be, patients are #1 priority. Staff are helpful and friendly.
cons: Govt & insurance rules/ regulations make for a large learning curve

review_title: Great company with a family environment.
job_title: Help Desk Technician in Stuart, FL
pros: Coworkers are friendly and the executive management is a pleasure to work for.
cons: The compensation could be better.

pros: Friendly, supportive, professional, lots of education offered.
cons: Members of management have been there forever, no opportunity for advancement unless someone quits or dies.

pros: Meeting difference people.  Helping the elderly
cons: In order to make any bonus the sale rep has to get 20 medicare referrals.  Most other companies you only have to get 15 medicare referrals.

review_title: The Best Nursing Job I've Had Since Becoming A Nurse
pros: The atmosphere is friendly, respectful, and professional. My manager is one of the finest women I've ever known.
cons: I can't think of anything at this time.

pros: Co-Workers are wonderful. Encouragement given to pursue professional and personal growth. Drive to want to become a better place to work at.
cons: Zero paid holidays. Hours are taken from PTO bank.

pros: Good Pay. Laid back Bosses. Autonomy
cons: Little room for advancement. Upper Mangement gets rotated out regularly. No standards in regard to Homecare. No health insurance for Field Nurses

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Stuart, FL
pros: Easy as pie, good hours
cons: A lot of “cliques,” lots of competition within.. no one to directly go to in case of issues.

review_title: VNA is a wonderful place to work
pros: VNA is one of the best places to work.
cons: There was no downside working for VNA,  I moved

pros: really great co-workers, family oriented/family friendly employers, great place to work
